document.title: ISTE (International Society for Technology in Education)

CA2A5800FC1C4B588EB41EEAA3C786E4.description:
Explore local and global issues and use collaborative
technologies to work with others to investigate solutions.

47FB44B0B02748EAA26E98B53E952841.description:
Contribute constructively to project teams, assuming various
roles and responsibilities to work effectively toward a
common goal.

1DAC42BB052548A9BDE095720AA083B9.description:
Use collaborative technologies to work with others, including
peers, experts or community members, to examine issues
and problems from multiple viewpoints.

D3D43DAC6D004F45A24D01AFE626B444.description:
Use digital tools to connect with learners from a variety of
backgrounds and cultures, engaging with them in ways that
broaden mutual understanding and learning.

FBEA222FE13D435F88F910F70376D008.description:
Global Collaborator - Students use digital tools to broaden their perspectives and
enrich their learning by collaborating with others and working
effectively in teams locally and globally. Students:

45D2AC8DF6584F1C97B08C99083217AF.description:
Publish or present content that customizes the message and
medium for their intended audiences.

AB6AE72788F94C5B8EDD643E7B3BC417.description:
Communicate complex ideas clearly and effectively by
creating or using a variety of digital objects such as
visualizations, models or simulations.

B214DF3884FD448EA77165C7BA84996B.description:
Create original works or responsibly repurpose or remix
digital resources into new creations.

8DBF9D605E0045E28337710C717F705F.description:
Choose the appropriate platforms and tools for meeting the
desired objectives of their creation or communication.

A5DB5AE330B54394913CB4FD8EE3E8CC.description:
Creative Communicator - Students communicate clearly and express themselves
creatively for a variety of purposes using the platforms, tools,
styles, formats and digital media appropriate to their goals.
Students:

8DDF6D1C79884CE0BB18EADF7148514C.description:
Understand how automation works and use algorithmic
thinking to develop a sequence of steps to create and test
automated solutions.

DEA29DE193E64067B3EDA2EA037D8D6F.description:
Break problems into component parts, extract key
information, and develop descriptive models to understand
complex systems or facilitate problem-solving.

08281C9EE0A346A99CE18C46BFC2946B.description:
Collect data or identify relevant data sets, use digital tools to
analyze them, and represent data in various ways to facilitate
problem-solving and decision-making.

681C98C339F14BF5AD6B4284DA0380E8.description:
Formulate problem definitions suited for technology assisted
methods such as data analysis, abstract models and
algorithmic thinking in exploring and finding solutions.

7BF212C8B8D145EBB082CDA3B7FEDACF.description:
Computational Thinker - Students develop and employ strategies for understanding
and solving problems in ways that leverage the power of
technological methods to develop and test solutions. Students:

BB3CD77F3AD646EBBF8B13023F504057.description:
Exhibit a tolerance for ambiguity, perseverance and the
capacity to work with open-ended problems.

BA9E233656C54CC497463CD73B496F40.description:
Develop, test and refine prototypes as part of a cyclical
design process.Â

9BC96C31A984421C8DDD2373D4E7A397.description:
Select and use digital tools to plan and manage a design
process that considers design constraints and calculated risks.

6DC7342A23144A06ACD06E7F5588A14F.description:
Know and use a deliberate design process for generating
ideas, testing theories, creating innovative artifacts or
solving authentic problems.

194BE3C3C3FA4691A8E17E029CEBB5AA.description:
Innovative Designer - Students use a variety of technologies within a design process
to identify and solve problems by creating new, useful or
imaginative solutions. Students:

4B725ECC4DBD45E29F1C0F658677ED2D.description:
Build knowledge by actively exploring real-world issues
and problems, developing ideas and theories and pursuing
answers and solutions.

209A1826644A4052A9536751FACB07E8.description:
Curate information from digital resources using a variety
of tools and methods to create collections of artifacts that
demonstrate meaningful connections or conclusions.

5A9EF262361E4A83A1E8919CBB717A21.description:
Evaluate the accuracy, perspective, credibility and relevance
of information, media, data or other resources.

3CA8FC0B461747CC93F2AF10FD5A5B5A.description:
Plan and employ effective research strategies to locate
information and other resources for their intellectual or
creative pursuits

B2D82D42DFF140C0B0516F6CE236A88C.description:
Knowledge Constructor -Â Students critically curate a variety of resources using digital tools
to construct knowledge, produce creative artifacts and make
meaningful learning experiences for themselves and others.
Students:

E7E06EAE1DB349E7BE3CDDC72CBCEBDB.description:
Manage their personal data to maintain digital privacy and
security and are aware of data-collection technology used to
track their navigation online.

49D2166C8B65454998B887AC31BA4B67.description:
Demonstrate an understanding of and respect for the rights
and obligations of using and sharing intellectual property.

837A1A2621554EE4B1EF2623711F8560.description:
Engage in positive, safe, legal and ethical behavior when
using technology, including social interactions online or
when using networked devices.

F90E68209B2141979CB4DA1033FBAE07.description:
Cultivate and manage their digital identity and reputation
and are aware of the permanence of their actions in the
digital world.

58F76B16A07C4946BE9ECB0A491FB108.description:
Digital Citizen -Â Students recognize the rights, responsibilities and opportunities
of living, learning and working in an interconnected digital
world, and they act and model in ways that are safe, legal and
ethical. Students:

7E4285113882486A97AE51242B2132AD.description:
Understand the fundamental concepts of technology
operations, demonstrate the ability to choose, use and
troubleshoot current technologies and are able to transfer
their knowledge to explore emerging technologies.

F682A0DA93424A4CBF4AE6364D8738D5.description:
Use technology to seek feedback that informs and improves
their practice and to demonstrate their learning in a variety
of ways.

331DF0F87339474EB96ECEEB17FD74D8.description: Students build networks and customize their learning environments in ways that support the learning process.Â

AB3B2964689244D1AA9140B0FE62E773.description: Articulate and set personal learning goals, develop strategies leveraging technology to achieve them and reflect on the learning process itself to improve learning outcomes.

9C0CB41DD73C4C7DBCBF17761D3DEF03.description: Empowered Learner - Students leverage technology to take an active role in choosing, achieving and demonstrating competency in their learning goals, informed by the learning sciences. Â Students:Â
